title: Input Field Component Contract
description: Contract extracted from Figma Untitled UI Input field component. Defines all properties the LIT component must implement.

source.notes: Extracted via Figma Desktop MCP get_design_context on frame 1090:57817 and representative variant nodes

type.notes: Figma 'Input field' maps to 'default'. 'Payment input' shows card brand icon in leading slot.

label.description: Label text displayed above the input. Empty string = no label.
label.notes: Figma prop is boolean (Label=True/False). In code it's a string to carry the label text.

hint.description: Helper/hint text displayed below the input. In destructive state, renders as error message.
hint.notes: Figma prop is boolean (Hint text=True/False). In code it's a string.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown when input is empty.

value.description: Current input value. Controls Placeholder vs Filled visual state.

name.description: HTML name attribute for form participation.

inputType.notes: Standard HTML input types: text, email, password, number, tel, url, search, etc.

destructive.description: Error/destructive state. Changes border to red, shows alert icon, styles hint text as error.

disabled.description: Disabled state. Maps to Figma State=Disabled.

leadingIcon.description: Show leading icon slot (left side of input).

helpIcon.description: Show help/question-mark icon button (right side of input, before trailing elements).

leadingText.description: Text prefix shown inside input on left (used with type='leading-text'). E.g. 'http://', '$'.
leadingText.figmaProperty: n/a (visual content in Leading text variant)

required.description: HTML required attribute for form validation.

placeholder.description: Input has no value. Text color is Gray/500.

filled.description: Input has a value. Text color is Gray/900.

focused.description: Input is focused. Brand border + focus ring.

disabled.description: Input is non-interactive. Gray/50 background, muted text.

slots.leading-icon: Custom SVG icon for leading icon slot
slots.leading-dropdown: Dropdown trigger element for leading-dropdown variant
slots.trailing-dropdown: Dropdown trigger element for trailing-dropdown variant

events.kds-input: Fired on every input change. detail: { value: string }
events.kds-change: Fired on input blur after value change. detail: { value: string }
events.kds-help-click: Fired when help icon is clicked

notes: State (Placeholder/Filled/Focused/Disabled) is derived, not a prop: Placeholder=empty value, Filled=has value, Focused=:focus-within, Disabled=disabled attr
Destructive can combine with any state except Disabled in Figma
When destructive=true, border becomes Error/300, alert-circle icon appears trailing
When destructive=true and hint is set, hint text renders as error message
Leading icon uses a named slot for custom SVGs
Leading text (type=leading-text) uses leadingText prop for prefix like 'http://' or '$'
Help icon fires kds-help-click event; consumer handles tooltip/popover
Form participation: delegates to internal <input> for name/value/required

variantsAnalyzed: 1091:63799 (Default, no icon, no label, no hint, placeholder)
1094:7188 (Default, no icon, no label, destructive=true, filled)
notes: 6 type variants x 2 leadingIcon x 2 label x 2 hintText x 2 helpIcon x 2 destructive x 4 states = ~384 variants total
Focus ring uses Brand/100 (#F4EBFF) for normal, Error/100 (#FEF3F2) for destructive
Focused border: Brand/300 (#D6BBFB) normal, Error/300 (#FDA29B) destructive
Alert circle (16px) appears trailing when destructive=true (any state)
Help icon (16px) shown when helpIcon=true, between input text and alert circle
